alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Clark; Jackson; Juneau; La Crosse; Monroe; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 14 at 3:28PM CDT until April 14 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Continue Through Early Evening... .Unseasonably warm, dry and breezy conditions will continue to lead to critical fire weather conditions this afternoon across portions of west-central into central Wisconsin. Very dry fine fuels will promote quick ignitions and rapid spread of any fire that gets started, making it difficult to control. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST-CENTRAL AND CENTRAL WISCONSIN... * AFFECTED AREA...In Wisconsin, Clark, Buffalo, Trempealeau, Jackson, La Crosse, Monroe, Juneau and Adams. * TIMING...Until 8 pm this evening. * WINDS...South 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 17 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the low 80s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that start will quickly become difficult to control and spread rapidly. Please heed any local burning bans.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Buffalo; Clark; Jackson; Juneau; La Crosse; Monroe; Trempealeau
